sn15.9:1: At Sāvatthī. "Bhikkhus, this saṁsara is without discoverable beginning. A first point is not discerned of beings roaming and wandering on hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving. Just as a stick thrown up into the air falls now on its bottom, now on its side, and now on its top, so toosn.ii.85as beings roam and wander on hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving, now they go from this world to the other world, now they come from the other world to this world.[n.259] The simile is also atSN56.33.For what reason? Because, bhikkhus, this saṁsara is without discoverable beginning … . It is enough to be liberated from them."
